channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump's message discipline vanishes a day after convention
See what happened when Trump crowd was asked to wear masks
item.description: Before President Trump's speech in New Hampshire, the crowd booed an announcement at the event asking the attendees to wear masks.

item.title: Friends pay tribute to 'Black Panther' star Chadwick Boseman
Colon and rectal cancer cases are going up among people younger than age 50: researchers
item.description: Colon and rectal cancer are among the leading cause of cancer deaths in men and women in the US, with cases on the rise in young adults.

item.title: What do polls show about civil unrest impact on 2020?
item.description: As the support for protests and #BLM has waned, Biden's leads in Wisconsin and Minnesota have shrunk. Harry Enten says Trump 'wants the election to be about crime'

item.title: Jacob Blake's uncle slams police union's claims of what happened leading up to the shooting
item.description: Nearly a week since the police shooting of Jacob Blake in Wisconsin, Blake's uncle said the police union's version of events is "garbage" and "insulting."

item.title: Video shows forceful arrest of Black man stopped while jogging in San Antonio
item.description: A Black man in San Antonio was stopped and detained by police Tuesday while he was jogging, witnesses said, as officers searched for a suspect in a nearby domestic violence call.

item.title: Stelter: This is going to get under Trump's skin
item.description: President Trump's convention speech making the case for his reelection was lower-rated than his challenger Joe Biden's speech one week before, according to overnight Nielsen ratings. CNN's Brian Stelter explains.

item.title: In Brazil's Javari Valley, isolated communities fear Covid-19 'catastrophe'
item.description: Remote indigenous communities in Brazil, who have little or no contact with the outside world, are facing a grave threat from Covid-19 -- and advocates accuse the government of failing to protect these vulnerable groups.

item.title: US military won't settle disputes if election results are contested, top general says
item.description: America's most senior general, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Gen. Mark Milley, told members of Congress that the military will not play a role in November's election and won't help settle any disputes if the results are contested.

item.title: Former officer in George Floyd killing asks judge to dismiss case
item.description: Former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin has asked a judge to dismiss murder charges against him in the death of George Floyd.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
Berlin police halt march protesting against German government's coronavirus response
item.description: Berlin police ordered a halt to a demonstration Saturday protesting the German government's Covid-19 response, citing the crowd's failure to abide by social distancing guidelines.

item.title: Bernie Sanders promised to go all in for Biden. Here's what that looks like
item.description: Bernie Sanders loves the campaign trail. He wants to be "running around the country" hosting rallies, organizing canvasses and leading marches to the polls.

item.title: Europe's Covid-19 front line shifts as infections spike
item.description: At first, the front line of Europe's fight against the Covid-19 pandemic was fought in hospitals by overstretched health care workers. Now as European countries seek to avoid the long-dreaded second wave, that line has shifted to the streets and is being manned by police forces.

item.title: Banksy-funded rescue boat needs 'immediate assistance' after taking 219 migrants onboard
item.description: A rescue boat funded by the British street artist Banksy has said it urgently needs assistance after taking 219 migrants onboard in the Mediterranean.

item.title: New audio of Trump's sister: Donald has no principles
item.description: Maryanne Trump Barry, President Donald Trump's sister, is heard on secret audio recordings made by his niece, Mary Trump, describing the president as having "no principles" and only caring about his political base.

item.title: Belarus revokes accreditation for 15 journalists working for foreign media
item.description: Fifteen Belarusian journalists have had their accreditation to work for the BBC and other foreign media outlets removed by the authorities, the Belarusian Association of Journalists (BAJ) has said.

item.title: Beijing wants to control what people eat. Experts fear it's a step too far
item.description: A call from Beijing to reduce food waste has sent officials and businesses scrambling to find ways to stop people from ordering too much, and in some extreme cases put meal times under surveillance.

item.title: Kushner heads to Middle East looking to deliver some semblance of a peace deal
item.description: White House senior adviser Jared Kushner is traveling to the Middle East this weekend to try to convince multiple Arab leaders to attend a splashy signing ceremony at the White House for the recent normalization deal between the United Arab Emirates and Israel.

item.title: 'They spied on my campaign': How Trump transformed a conspiracy theory into a political rallying cry
item.description: President Donald Trump says all the time, "they spied on my campaign." He ad-libbed during his Thursday night convention speech to add the phrase into his prepared remarks. And he tweeted it last week as a rebuttal to former President Barack Obama's convention address.

item.title: As Laura heads east, hundreds of thousands are left behind with no power ahead of hot weekend
item.description: In one coastal Louisiana community, the power may be out for months after Hurricane Laura lashed the state with violent winds and heavy rain earlier this week.

item.title: The crazy-but-true story of a WWII fighter pilot who said his artificial legs saved his life
item.description: This could be one of the most bizarre "Jeopardy!" clues ever:

item.title: Watch lightning strike as groom makes 2020 joke at wedding
item.description: Aaron and Denice Sawitsky got married in front of a small group of guests in Massachusetts, but not before lightning struck as the groom began to share his vows with the bride.

item.title: Coronavirus outbreaks identified at 4 sororities at Kansas State University
item.description: Coronavirus outbreaks have been identified at four sororities at Kansas State University.

item.title: Born out of racial tensions, Notting Hill Carnival has a rich history. What can we expect this year?
item.description: Vibrant parades, feathered dancers, infectious live music, and the aroma of delectable Afro-Caribbean cuisine -- these are the things many people look forward to when they descend on the streets of west London during the UK's August holiday weekend.

item.title: Are these fast, cheap coronavirus tests the game-changer everyone is waiting for?
item.description: Move over, slowpoke coronavirus tests that take a week or more to return a result -- there's a new generation of rapid tests coming to town -- some are already here -- and they're poised to transform the landscape. They are the antigen tests, but are they really all they're cracked up to be?

item.title: India struggles to contain its growing Covid-19 cases
item.description: The number of new coronavirus cases in India continues to skyrocket. CNN's Michael Holmes reports even though states are ramping up testing, getting the epidemic under control is easier said than done.

item.title: This endangered penguin loves to watch a show about penguins
item.description: It can be a little lonely when you're the only endangered rockhopper penguin being cared for at a zoo in all of Australasia.

item.title: Reporter has close call with blast of electricity live on air
item.description: Hurricane Laura pushes around reporters covering the storm. CNN's Jeanne Moos has the wettest, wildest reporter moments.

item.title: What China's 'carrier killer' missile tests say about its military capabilities
item.description: China launched a series of ballistic missiles into the South China Sea this week, according to United States defense officials, part of a flurry of military exercises extending thousands of miles along the country's coastline, as tensions with Washington over the disputed waterway continue to escalate.

item.title: These retailers filed for bankruptcy in August. Here's who might be next
item.description: The breakneck pace of retail bankruptcies slowed in August, with at least three well-known companies filing for Chapter 11.

item.title: A man built a backyard squirrel bar with seven varieties of nuts on tap
item.description: People are going nuts for an Ohio woodworker's latest creation: A bar that caters to neighborhood squirrels.

item.title: Sean Penn on Trump's Covid-19 response: When crisis comes to incompetence
item.description: Actor and activist Sean Penn talks to CNN's Anderson Cooper about life during the pandemic and his work on coronavirus testing in the US. Watch Anderson Cooper Full Circle every Monday, Tuesday, and Friday at 6p E.T.

item.title: Tour de France: Grappling with staging the world's toughest bike race in a pandemic
item.description: It's set to be a Tour de France like no other.

item.title: Colbert sees endless possibilities for Melania's dress
item.description: Late-night comedian Stephen Colbert sounds off on President Donald Trump's speech during the final night of the Republican National Convention.

item.title: 'Say it Loud' documentary details harsh reality of Black MLS soccer players
item.description: Major League Soccer, as with a large number of other sports leagues in the United States and across the world, is back in full swing. And like other athletes, the Black Players for Change in MLS (BPC) are looking for a way that they can lend their support to the fight against systemic racism -- beyond statements of support, and images of solidarity.

item.title: Elon Musk shows off a working brain implant — in pigs
item.description: Elon Musk promised that he'd show a working demo of his latest technology moonshot, a new kind of implantable chip for the brain, on Friday. And he did, but it wasn't with a human subject: Rather, it was with a pig named Gertrude.

item.title: The Democrats are making a case for Trump
item.description: A group of Democrats make the case for members of their party to back President Trump.

item.title: Coca-Cola cutting thousands of jobs as soda sales crater
item.description: Coca-Cola will cut thousands of jobs and reduce its number of business units as it faces declining beverage sales in the pandemic.

item.title: Kanye West's strange presidential bid unravels thanks to messy ballot operation
item.description: Kanye West is on the ballot in Minnesota and Tennessee but just missed the filing deadline in Wisconsin. Missouri said his petition lacked more than 3,400 valid signatures, but he's gone to court in a last-ditch attempt to get on the ballot in the swing state of Ohio.

item.title: Planet-friendly activities that are good for your body and pandemic possible
item.description: What's the perfect pandemic hobby? As people across the globe have adjusted their lives to Covid-19, activities as varied as bread baking and gaming have trended.

item.title: The restraint the US President showed at his party's convention disappeared at his latest campaign rally as he told supporters he would 'wing it'
item.description: President Donald Trump and his rival Joe Biden presented two alternate realities of the state of America at their conventions over the past two weeks -- and the President's ability to persuade wavering moderates and independents will hinge on his ability to stay on message.

item.title: Trump launches baseless attack on Kamala Harris
item.description: • Analysis: Trump's answer on what he would do in a second term was unintelligible • Biden hits Trump where it hurts: in TV ratings • Watch: See what happened when Trump crowd was asked to wear masks

item.title: Why Democrats are worried about Kenosha
item.description: Former Vice President Joe Biden and President Donald Trump and President Donald Trump both recognize the potential political fallouts if protests in the wake of the Jacob Blake shooting are seen as peaceful or as violent. Biden benefits if they are seen as the former, while Trump is helped if they are seen as the latter.

item.title: Friends pay tribute to actor Chadwick Boseman
item.description: • Analysis: Boseman gave us the superhero we so desperately needed

item.title: Cruise trips are back. This is what they look like now
item.description: Boarding in the Italian port of Genoa for a seven-day Mediterranean cruise on August 16, travel agent Valeria Belardi prepared herself for a voyage like no other.

item.title: What it's like to fly into Australia right now
item.description: An empty airport. A plane that usually holds over 300 people, taking off with just a few dozen passengers.

item.title: Paradise islands reopen only to visitors who've had Covid-19
item.description: The turquoise waters and golden sand beaches of Brazil's Fernando de Noronha archipelago have reopened after being off-limits due to coronavirus, but authorities say its only accessible to those who have had Covid-19.
